TI: Long-term in vivo and in vitro AAV-2-mediated RNA interference in rat retinal ganglion cells and cultured primary neurons.
AB: Viral vector-based expression of small interfering RNAs is a promising tool for gene regulation, both in cultured cells and in animal models. In this study, we analysed the ability of adeno-associated virus-2 to function as an RNAi vector in cultured primary hippocampal neurons in vitro and in retinal ganglion cells in vivo. We demonstrate a long-lasting, highly efficient, and specific down-regulation of gene expression in vivo and in vitro by the use of bicistronic vectors. This is the first evidence of a cell type-specific long-term (more than three-month-long) RNAi in the eye. Furthermore, our results constitute the prerequisite for the use of this technique in models of neurodegeneration and neuroregeneration in vivo and in vitro.
AD: Viral Vector Laboratory, Department of Neurology, University of Gottingen, Waldweg 33, 37073 Gottingen, Germany. umichel@gwdg.de <umichel@gwdg.de>
SO: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2005 Jan 14;326(2):307-12. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2004.11.029.
